articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Foreign Heads of State and Government
    Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, who was attending the Asia-Africa Summit, separately met and had conversations with the Nepalese king, the
Cambodian prime minister, the Mongolian president, the Vietnamese president, the sultan of Brunei Darussalam, the sultan of the Sultanate of Oman, the Zimbabwean president, the Malaysian prime minister, the Thai prime minister and the Algerian president on April 22.
 Kim conveyed greetings of leader Kim Jong Il to the above-said heads of state and government.    
 They expressed deep thanks for this and asked Kim Yong Nam to transmit their sincere regards to Kim Jong Il.    
 Kim Yong Nam and the heads of state and government exchanged views on the issues of boosting the bilateral relations and a series of international issues of mutual concern.
 Conversations took place in a warm atmosphere.

Photo Exhibition and Film Show Held
    Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- A photo exhibition and film show were arranged by the Ministry of Foreign Trade for the Economic and Commercial Councilors' Corps here at the Pyongyang Cultural Exhibition Hall Friday on the occasion of the 73rd birthday of the heroic Korean People's Army.
 The participants looked round with keen interest photos showing the immortal Songun exploits of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il and successes made by the army and people of the DPRK in the drive to build a great prosperous powerful socialist nation under his wise leadership.    
 Then they appreciated a Korean documentary "For the Liberation of the Country".

Congratulations to FM of Zimbabwe
    Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a congratulatory message to Simbarashe Mumbengegii upon his appointment as foreign minister of Zimbabwe.
 In the belief that the good ties of friendship and solidarity between the two countries would continue to grow stronger in the mutual interests of the two peoples, the message sincerely wished him success in his new job.

Norwegian Foreign Ministry Delegation Here
    Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Norwegian Foreign Ministry headed by Vidar Helgesen, secretary of state of the ministry, arrived here today.
 It was greeted at the airport by an official concerned and the Swedish ambassador to the DPRK.
